title: Critical Service-Learning for Integrating Social Innovation and Equity

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and general interest in social issues
context.additional_context: Emphasizes social problem-solving projects using the mathematics domain, integrating the EDI (Equity, Diversity, Inclusion) framework with field-linked service learning.

learning_goals: Learners demonstrate the ability to analyze complex social issues through mathematical modeling and identify structural inequalities

When designing public service projects reflecting EDI (Equity, Diversity, Inclusion) principles, learners identify at least three potential bias factors and write a critical-thinking report proposing two actionable solutions. (Assessed at program completion.)
Learners collaborate with community partners to develop data-driven solutions and establish behavior change plans

resources: EDI (Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion) Educational Resource Package

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
